<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The historians work from the outer to the inner; from the</l>

              <corr>they</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">dwell upon; the chairs and the furniture of the house.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the voice of Anon singing at the back door the English</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">might be a dumb race, who suffered

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a race of

            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">stone houses, cultivated fields and vast cathedrals. but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">not <add hand="typewriter" place="above">no</add> words. The great house is silent; Only the furniture</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>

              <corr>remains</corr>
            </choice>, stiff and ornate, 
            <choice>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">At <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-gorh" key="Gorhambury">Gorhambury</rs> for instance <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-abac" key="Bacon, Ann">Lady Bacon</rs> sat at her table</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">writing <add hand="ms" place="above">letters</add>. <del hand="ms">But</del> <add hand="ms" place="inline">H</add>er letters to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-fbac" key="Bacon, Francis">her son</rs> are letter written <add hand="ms" place="above">[illeg.]</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">from the pulpit; as intricate involved and formal as state</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">papers or legal documents or 
            <choice>
              <sic>dyin depositons</sic>
              <corr>dying depositions</corr>
